result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kameron D Campbell

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kameron D Campbell in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Kameron D Campbell.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for pretrial conference. 
Defense counsel informed the Court this may be a deferred prosecution agreement. Defense requests a DPA hearing. 
Case adjourned to Branch 13. 
Parties are advised that effective 10/31/2022, pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-17, this case will be reassigned to Branch 37, Judge Dee in Room 515 of the Courthouse.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Kameron D Campbell in court.  Attorney Corey R. Flynn in court for Kameron D Campbell.  Prosecuting attorney Nate Kristian McClure in court for the State of Wisconsin. Pretrial conference held. Attorney Flynn has discovery, parties are pursuing a DPA resolution. Defendant has TAD evaluation scheduled. Case is adjourned in Branch 13.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. 
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 9/12/2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR, A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant Kameron D Campbell in court. Attorney Madaline Witte in court for the State of Wisconsin under the student practice rule. 
Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Reserve Judge, Branch 13.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 13 for a Pretrial Conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 9/9/22 @ 2p
